00013 /*
00014         <---MAXREF
00015         
00016                 /maxref/object/name
00017                         jcom.delta
00018 
00019                 /maxref/object/digest
00020                         Calculate difference between incomming numbers
00021 
00022                 /maxref/object/description
00023                         <o>jcom.delta</o> calculates the difference between the last incomming value x[n]
00024                         and the previous value received:<br/>
00025                         delta = x[n]-x[n-1] 
00026 
00027 
00028 
00029                 /maxref/metadata/author
00030                         Trond Lossius
00031 
00032                 /maxref/metadata/tag
00033                         Jamoma Max Math
00034 
00035 
00036 
00037                 /maxref/inletlist/0
00038                         Calculate Difference, int, float
00039 
00040                 /maxref/outletlist/0
00041                         Delta Value
00042 
00043                 /maxref/outletlist/1            
00044                         Dumpout
00045 
00046 
00047 
00048                 /maxref/argument/
00049                         None
00050 
00051 
00052 
00053                 /maxref/message/float
00054                         Caculate difference using between this and the previous number received.
00055 
00056                 /maxref/message/int
00057                         Converted to float
00058 
00059 
00060                 
00061                 /maxref/example/image   
00062                         jcom.delta.gif
00063                         
00064                 /maxref/example/caption
00065                         Calculate difference between the last two numbers received.
00066 
00067 
00068                 
00069                 /maxref/seealso/object/name
00070                         jcom.delta2
00071

00073                         Calculate the 2nd order difference of incomming numbers.
00074                 
00075                 /maxref/seealso/object/name
00076                         jcom.velocity

00084 
00085 #include "Jamoma.h"
00086 
00087 typedef struct _delta{                  // Data structure for this object 
00088         t_object        ob;                             // Must always be the first field; used by Max
00089         void            *obex;
00090         float           prev;                   // Previous value
00091         float           delta;                  // delta step
00092         char            clearflag;
00093         void            *outlet;                        // Pointer to outlet. need one for each outlet 
00094 } t_delta;
00095 
00096 // Prototypes for methods: need a method for each incoming message
00097 void *delta_new(void);
00098 void delta_bang(t_delta *x);
00099 void delta_int(t_delta *x, long n);
00100 void delta_float(t_delta *x, double f);
00101 void delta_clear(t_delta *x);
00102 void delta_set(t_delta *x, Symbol *s, short ac, Atom *setval);
00103 void delta_assist(t_delta *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);
00104 
00105 
00106 
00107 // Globals
00108 t_class         *this_class;                            // Required. Global pointing to this class 
00109 
00110 
00111 
00112 /************************************************************************************/
00113 // Main() Function
00114 
00115 int main(void)
00116 {       
00117         t_class *c;
00118         
00119         jamoma_init();
00120 
00121         // Define our class
00122         c = class_new("jcom.delta",(method)delta_new, (method)0L, (short)sizeof(t_delta), (method)0L, 0, 0);
00123         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_delta, obex));                             
00124 
00125         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00126         class_addmethod(c, (method)delta_bang,                          "bang",         A_CANT,         0);
00127         class_addmethod(c, (method)delta_int,                           "int",          A_LONG,         0);
00128         class_addmethod(c, (method)delta_float,                         "float",        A_FLOAT,        0);             
00129         class_addmethod(c, (method)delta_assist,                        "assist",       A_CANT,         0); 
00130     class_addmethod(c, (method)delta_set,                               "set",          A_GIMME,        0);  
00131     class_addmethod(c, (method)delta_clear,                             "clear",        0);
00132         class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,         "dumpout",      A_CANT,         0);  
00133     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref", A_CANT,             0);
00134         //finder_addclass("All Objects","jcom.delta");  
00135         //finder_addclass("Arith/Logic/Bitwise","jcom.delta");
00136         //post("tl.delta © 2001-03 Trond Lossius");
00137         
00138         
00139         // Finalize our class
00140         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00141         this_class = c;
00142         return 0;
00143 }
00144 
00145 
00146 /************************************************************************************/
00147 // Object Life
00148 
00149 void *delta_new(void)
00150 {
00151         t_delta *x;
00152         
00153         x = (t_delta *)object_alloc(this_class);        // create the new instance and return a pointer to it
00154         if(x){
00155         object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x,NULL));       // dumpout      
00156                 x->outlet = floatout(x);                                // create the outlet
00157                 delta_clear(x);                                                 // initilaize instance
00158         }
00159         return (x);
00160 }
00161 
00162 
00163 /************************************************************************************/
00164 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00165 
00166 
00167 // BANG input
00168 void delta_bang(t_delta *x)
00169 {
00170         outlet_float(x->outlet, x->delta);
00171 }
00172 
00173 
00174 // INT input
00175 void delta_int(t_delta *x, long n)
00176 {
00177         double f;
00178         
00179         f = (double)n;
00180         delta_float(x,f);
00181 }
00182 
00183 
00184 // FLOAT input
00185 void delta_float(t_delta *x, double f)
00186 {
00187         if (x->clearflag) {
00188                 x->prev = f;
00189                 x->delta = 0;
00190                 x->clearflag = 0;
00191         }
00192         else {
00193                 x->delta = f - x->prev;
00194                 x->prev = f;
00195         }
00196         delta_bang(x);
00197 }
00198 
00199 
00200 // SET input
00201 void delta_set(t_delta *x, Symbol *s, short ac, Atom *setval)
00202 {
00203         float f;
00204         
00205         if (ac) {
00206                 if (setval->a_type==A_LONG)
00207                         f = (float)setval->a_w.w_long;
00208                 else if (setval->a_type==A_FLOAT)
00209                         f = setval->a_w.w_float;
00210                 else goto err;
00211         }
00212         else
00213                 f=0;
00214         if (x->clearflag) {
00215                 x->prev = f;
00216                 x->delta = 0;
00217                 x->clearflag = 0;
00218         }
00219         else {
00220                 x->delta = f - x->prev;
00221                 x->prev = f;
00222         }
00223         return;
00224         
00225         err:
00226                 error("jcom.delta: Wrong argument for set");
00227 }
00228 
00229 
00230 // CLEAR input
00231 void delta_clear(t_delta *x)
00232 {
00233         x->clearflag = 1;
00234         x->delta = 0;
00235 }
00236 
00237 
00238 // Method for Assistance Messages
00239 void delta_assist(t_delta *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)   // Display assistance messages
00240 {
00241         if(msg==1)
00242         { 
00243                 switch(arg)
00244                 {
00245                         case 0: sprintf(dst, "(int/float) function value");
00246                         break;  
00247                 }
00248         }
00249         else if(msg==2)
00250         {
00251                 sprintf(dst, "(float) delta value");
00252         }
00253 }
